Post.title: Let's Encrypt
Post._content:
### Let's EncryptSSL

[Let's Encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org/)

Let's EncryptISRG

Let's Encrypt90Let's Encrypt

[Certbot](https://certbot.eff.org/)HttpsCertbotWebOSNginx + CentOS 6

[https://certbot.eff.org/#centos6-nginx](https://certbot.eff.org/#centos6-nginx)

0. #### 

	0. certbot-auto

		```
		wget https://dl.eff.org/certbot-auto
		chmod a+x certbot-auto
		```
	0. 

		```./certbot-auto``````Virtualenv Command Not Found```[pip](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/installing/)virtualenv```pip install virtualenv```

	0. Nginx
		
		https/.well-knownLet's Encrypt/var/www/www.xxx.com/.well-knownhttp://www.xxx.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/HGr8U1IeTW4kY_Z6UIyaakzOkyQgPr_7ArlLgtZE8SXurl

		Nginxnginx -s reloadreloadrestart
		
		```
		server {

			...			

			location /.well-known {
	        	alias /var/www/www.xxx.com/.well-known;
	    	}

			...

		}
		```

		*Nginx*

	0. 

		```./certbot-auto certonly```Nginx

		**certbot-auto```./certbot-auto certonly --webroot -w /var/www/www.xxx.com -d xxx.com -d www.xxx.com -w /var/www/thing -d thing.is -d m.thing.is```**

		/etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/

0. #### Nginx

	Nginx```nginx -s reload```reloadrestart

	```
	server {

		...
		listen 443;

	    ssl on;
        ssl_stapling_verify on;
        ssl_certificate         /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/fullchain.pem;
        ssl_certificate_key     /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/privkey.pem;

		...

	}
	```

0. #### 

	

0. #### 

	Let's Encrypt90Let's Encrypt

	

	```certbot-auto renew --dry-run``````certbot-auto renew --quiet```cron

	```
	01 1 * * * ./path/to/certbot-auto renew --quiet
	```
	11

		chmod a+x certbot-auto

	0. Nginx
		
		https/.well-knownLet's Encrypt/var/www/www.xxx.com/.well-knownhttp://www.xxx.com/.well-known/acme-challenge/HGr8U1IeTW4kY_Z6UIyaakzOkyQgPr_7ArlLgtZE8SXurl

			...			

			location /.well-known {

0. #### Nginx

	Nginx```nginx -s reload```reloadrestart

	server {

	01 1 * * * ./path/to/certbot-auto renew --quiet
	```

Post.content:
Lets EncryptSSL

Lets Encrypt

Lets EncryptISRG

Lets Encrypt90Lets Encrypt

CertbotHttpsCertbotWebOSNginx + CentOS 6

https://certbot.eff.org/#centos6-nginx

    1. certbot-auto

    2. server {

      ...            

location /.well-known {
    alias /var/www/www.xxx.com/.well-known;
}

...

      }

      server {


      listen 443;

      ssl on;
      ssl_stapling_verify on;
      ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/fullchain.pem;
      ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/privkey.pem;

      }

      01 1 * ./path/to/certbot-auto renew quiet
      ```
      11

}

...

      }

      server {


      listen 443;

      ssl on;
      ssl_stapling_verify on;
      ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/fullchain.pem;
      ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/www.xxx.com/privkey.pem;

      }

      01 1 * ./path/to/certbot-auto renew quiet

Post.title: docker
Post._content:
: <>[] docker version dockerGo docker info (docker)images, containers docker search docker indeximage docker pull docker registry server image docker push imagerepositoryregistry docker push :TAG tag docker inspect imagecontainer docker images TODO filter out the intermediate image layers (intermediate image layers ) docker images -a images docker ps container docker ps -l container docker ps -a container docker logs container docker rm container docker rm `docker ps -a -q` container docker ps -a -q | xargs docker rm , container docker rmi image docker start/stop/restart //container docker start -i container docker attach attachcontainer docker run imagecontainer docker run -i -t /bin/bash imagecontainer, login shell/bin/bash docker run -i -t -p container docker commit [repo:tag] containerimagerepo:tag docker build pathDockerfileimage docker build -t repo[:tag] repotag docker build - < dockerfiledockerstdinimage docker port containerdocker ps ### docker 1. ``` $ sudo yum update $ sudo curl -sSL https://get.docker.com/ | sh ``` 2. ``` $ sudo yum update $ sudo yum -y install docker $ sudo systemctl start docker ``` ### ##### continer -q id ``` docker rm $(docker ps -a -q) ``` ##### ``` docker rmi $(docker images | grep none | awk '{print $3}' | sort -r) ``` ### 1. go ``` docker images --format "{{.ID}}: {{.Repository}}" docker images --format "table {{.ID}}\t{{.Repository}}\t{{.Tag}}" ``` 2. filter ``` docker images -f since=mongo:3.2 ``` 3.2 3. docker run -it --rm --name ryanserver ubuntu:14.04 bash it rm ubuntu bash bash naem container ``` docker run --name webserver -d -p 85:80 nginx ``` 4. docker commit [OPTIONS] CONTAINER [REPOSITORY[:TAG]] - -a : - -c :Dockerfile - -m : - -p :commit ``` $ docker commit \ --author "Tao Wang " \ --message "" \ webserver \ nginx:v2 ``` 5.dockfile ``` FROM nginx RUN echo '

Hello, Docker!

' > /usr/share/nginx/html/index.html ``` from Dockerfilerun && Dockerfile Shell \ # copy Go filepath.Match ``` COPY hom* /mydir/ COPY hom?.txt /mydir/ ``` Add copy ``` FROM scratch ADD ubuntu-xenial-core-cloudimg-amd64-root.tar.gz / ``` ###### ENV ENV = =... ENV VERSION=1.0 DEBUG=on \ NAME="Happy Feet ###### Dockerfile /data docker run -d -v mydata:/data xxxx ###### host hostcontainer docker ``` docker run -it -v /home/dock/Downloads:/usr/Downloads ubuntu64 /bin/bash ``` -v dockfile: ``` MAINTAINER Anna Doe nodejs pm2: FROM node:0.11.13 # or just node, without tag RUN npm install -g pm2 RUN pm2 dump # dump will start pm2 daemon and create everything needed VOLUME ["/srv/apps", "/srv/logs", "/srv/server.json"] # don't put the files in docker container, user -v EXPOSE 3000 CMD ["pm2", "start", "/srv/server.json", "--no-daemon"] # no daemon mode for docker ``` 6. docker build -t repo[:tag] . repotag docker build .. copy 7. container (Export) Export sudo docker export > /home/export.tar docker import ``` cat busy.tar | sudo docker import - busy:v1.0 ``` 8. sudo docker save busybox-1 > /home/save.tar ``` docker load docker import ``` 9. docker container ``` docker run -ti --restart=on-failure:3 ``` 10. rootdocker root ``` docker sudo groupadd docker docker sudo gpasswd -a ${USER} docker dockerCentOS7 sudo systemctl restart docker docker docker ps ``` 11.docker zookeeper ``` ps -aux | grep docker docker run --name alizookeeper --restart always -d -P zookeeper ```

Hello, Docker!

' > /usr/share/nginx/html/index.html ``` from Dockerfilerun && Dockerfile Shell \ # copy Go filepath.Match ``` COPY hom* /mydir/ COPY hom?.txt /mydir/ ``` Add copy ``` FROM scratch ADD ubuntu-xenial-core-cloudimg-amd64-root.tar.gz / ``` ###### ENV ENV = =... ENV VERSION=1.0 DEBUG=on \ NAME="Happy Feet ###### Dockerfile /data docker run -d -v mydata:/data xxxx ###### host hostcontainer docker ``` docker run -it -v /home/dock/Downloads:/usr/Downloads ubuntu64 /bin/bash ``` -v dockfile: ``` MAINTAINER Anna Doe nodejs pm2: FROM node:0.11.13 # or just node, without tag RUN npm install -g pm2 RUN pm2 dump # dump will start pm2 daemon and create everything needed VOLUME ["/srv/apps", "/srv/logs", "/srv/server.json"] # don't put the files in docker container, user -v EXPOSE 3000 CMD ["pm2", "start", "/srv/server.json", "--no-daemon"] # no daemon mode for docker ``` 6. docker build -t repo[:tag] . repotag docker build .. copy 7. container (Export) Export sudo docker export > /home/export.tar docker import ``` cat busy.tar | sudo docker import - busy:v1.0 ``` 8. sudo docker save busybox-1 > /home/save.tar ``` docker load docker import ``` 9. docker container ``` docker run -ti --restart=on-failure:3 ``` 10. rootdocker root ``` docker sudo groupadd docker docker sudo gpasswd -a ${USER} docker dockerCentOS7 sudo systemctl restart docker docker docker ps ``` 11.docker zookeeper ``` ps -aux | grep docker docker run --name alizookeeper --restart always -d -P zookeeper ```

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

title: Hello World
---
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Post.title: hexo
Post._content:
# install
NodeGit,,blog,hexo,blogHexo

Hexo

sudo npm install -g hexo

inithexo,

hexo init

blog



hexo generatehexo g





hexo server

http://localhost:4000



# Github
Repository

your_user_name.github.io

blog/Users/leopard/blogblog

  _config.yml  node_modules  public   source

  db.json    package.json  scaffolds themes

_config.yml

vim _config.yml



deploy:

  type: git

  repo: https://github.com/leopardpan/leopardpan.github.io.git

  branch: master



npm install hexo-deployer-git --save

 
# 

hexo new"postName" #

hexo new page"pageName" #

hexo generate #public

hexo server #4000'ctrl + c'server

hexo deploy #.deployGitHub

hexo help # 

hexo version #Hexo

Post.title: pm2
Post._content:
### pm2 start 

1.  pm2 ecosystem 
2. 

```
min_uptime60s60spm2max_restarts

exec_modecluster_modefork
error_file
out_file
pid_filepid
watchfalsetruepm2

exec_interpretershellnodejs
defaults to node. can be python, ruby, bash or whatever interpreter you wish to use. none will execute your app as a binary executable

babel exec_interpreter:"babel-node"
 
max_memory_restart  

```

3. watch 
   
```
{
  "name"        : "fis-receiver",  // 
  "script"      : "./bin/www",  // 
  "cwd"         : "./",  // 
  "watch": [  // 
    "bin",
    "routers"
  ],
  "ignore_watch" : [  // 
    "node_modules", 
    "logs",
    "public"
  ],
  "watch_options": {
    "followSymlinks": false
  },
  "error_file" : "./logs/app-err.log",  // 
  "out_file"   : "./logs/app-out.log",  // 
  "env": {
      "NODE_ENV": "production"  // 
  }
}
```

Post.title: loadtest
Post._content:
### loadtest 
powershell linux bash 

post body 



-T 

-c 

-n 

-m  get,put,post

--rps 

-P Request body 

-p body 

-H header 

-C cookie
```
param(
    [int] $iterations = 6000,
    [int] $rps = 500,
    [string][ValidateSet("plaintext")] $variation = "plaintext")

if ($variation -eq "plaintext")
{
    $url = "http://wh.etao.cn/auth/test"
}

Write-Host -ForegroundColor Green Beginning workload
Write-Host "`& loadtest -k -n $iterations -c 100 --rps $rps $url"
Write-Host

& loadtest -k -n $iterations -c 100 --rps $rps $url
```

```
loadtest -c 5 -t 2 -m post -T 'application/json'  -P '{"message":"hello"}'  -H "Accept: application/json; q=0.9, application/xml; q=0.6" http://cttest.etao.cn:8011/api/auth/test
```

Post.title: postgre
Post.content:
The library supports named parameters in query formatting, with the syntax of $propName, where * is any of the following open-close pairs: {}, (), <>, [], //

this

which will execute:

INSERT INTO documents(id, doc) VALUES(123, {id:123,body:some text})

And when you are not expecting any return results, call db.proc instead. Both methods return a Promise object, but db.proc doesnt take a qrm parameter, always assuming it is one|none.

promise
Post.more:
The library supports named parameters in query formatting, with the syntax of $propName, where * is any of the following open-close pairs: {}, (), <>, [], //

this

which will execute:

INSERT INTO documents(id, doc) VALUES(123, {id:123,body:some text})

And when you are not expecting any return results, call db.proc instead. Both methods return a Promise object, but db.proc doesnt take a qrm parameter, always assuming it is one|none.

promise

Post.title: webpack
Post._content:
WebPackJavaScriptScssTypeScript

Webpacksource maps

http://www.jianshu.com/p/42e11515c10f

loader

css 

```
{
        test: /\.css$/,
        loader: 'style!css?modules'//?modules
}
```

LoadersPluginsloadersJSXScssLess..

####  


```
$ webpack --config webpack.min.js //

$ webpack --display-error-details //

$ webpack --watch   //
 
$ webpack -p    //
 
$ webpack -d    //map
```



```
entry: {
  vendor: ["jquery", "other-lib"],
  app: "./entry"
}
new CommonsChunkPlugin({
  name: "vendor",

  // filename: "vendor.js"
  // (Give the chunk a different name)

  minChunks: Infinity,
  // (with more entries, this ensures that no other module
  //  goes into the vendor chunk)
})
```

express webpack middleware 

http://www.cnblogs.com/linfangshuhellowored/p/5657285.html

hash

chunkhashchunkhashhashhashwebpackoutput
```
output: {
    filename: '[name].[chunkhash:8].js',
    path: __dirname + '/built'
}
output: {
    filename: '[name].[hash:8].js',
    path: __dirname + '/built'
}
```
